intent_atoms.description: Add regression tests for tolerant traversal that exercise truncated, overlapping, and malformed-header corrupt fixtures using the tolerant pipeline options.
Each test must assert that traversal continues beyond the corrupt node, verifies emitted ParseIssue reason codes/ranges, and checks aggregate metrics (counts/depth) match manifest expectations.
CLI or exporter-facing smoke tests must confirm tolerant runs produce warnings without aborting, ensuring UI/CLI wiring remains regression-free.
Strict-mode control coverage must remain unchanged; paired assertions that .strict runs still throw/abort as documented.
The ParseIssueStore metrics and summary functions (makeIssueSummary(), metricsSnapshot()) must accurately reflect aggregated warnings during tolerant traversal.

Extend Tests/ISOInspectorKitTests/ParsePipelineLiveTests.swift or add a dedicated TolerantTraversalRegressionTests suite to stream corrupt fixtures with .tolerant options and assert continued event emission.

functional_units.name: Tolerant Parsing Pipeline
functional_units.description: Processes box trees while continuing traversal after encountering corrupted nodes and records ParseIssue entries

functional_units.name: ParseIssue Store
functional_units.description: Aggregates parse issues, provides metrics snapshots and issue summaries for UI ribbons and CLI summaries

functional_units.name: Regression Test Suite – Tolerant Traversal Tests
functional_units.description: XCTest coverage that streams corrupt fixtures with tolerant options, asserts continued event emission and verifies ParseIssue reason codes/ranges and aggregate metrics

functional_units.name: CLI/Exporter Smoke Tests
functional_units.description: Snapshot or textual tests confirming tolerant runs produce warnings without aborting, ensuring UI/CLI wiring remains functional

functional_units.name: Strict Mode Control Tests
functional_units.description: Paired assertions that strict parsing runs still throw/abort as documented
